commit_message:
Train and before: Pin rexml on CentOS7

... because the latest rexml 3.2.5 is not compabible with the old ruby
on CentOS7 because of [1], and results in the following syntax error.

rexml-3.2.5/lib/rexml/parsers/baseparser.rb:515:
syntax error, unexpected ',' (SyntaxError)

[1] https://github.com/ruby/rexml/commit/9b311e59ae05749e082eb6bbefa1cb620d1a786e
Change-Id: I9caf233a3bebfb17e7df03583b57a97d8e04583c

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-04 16:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-03-05 12:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

I think the metal_query ansible_facts rewrite looks wrong, and more complex and confusing than the original. And IMO not worth the speed gained by trying to ansible_facts[] here.

See inline notes.

My opinion would be to keep the fact gathering reduction, and drop the metal_query modification.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-05 14:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Published edit on patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-05 14:54:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

> Patch Set 13:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> I think the metal_query ansible_facts rewrite looks wrong, and more complex and confusing than the original. And IMO not worth the speed gained by trying to ansible_facts[] here.
> 
> See inline notes.
> 
> My opinion would be to keep the fact gathering reduction, and drop the metal_query modification.

I've changed it to ansible_facts.{{  }}.ipv4.address in metal_query. The use of ansible_facts rather than ansible_<interface> is all-or-nothing, if we ever want to set ANSIBLE_INJECT_FACTS_AS_VARS=False"}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-05 14:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-03-05 15:58:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

(2 comments)

> Patch Set 14:
> 
> > Patch Set 13:
> > 
> > (1 comment)
> > 
> > I think the metal_query ansible_facts rewrite looks wrong, and more complex and confusing than the original. And IMO not worth the speed gained by trying to ansible_facts[] here.
> > 
> > See inline notes.
> > 
> > My opinion would be to keep the fact gathering reduction, and drop the metal_query modification.
> 
> I've changed it to ansible_facts.{{  }}.ipv4.address in metal_query. The use of ansible_facts rather than ansible_<interface> is all-or-nothing, if we ever want to set ANSIBLE_INJECT_FACTS_AS_VARS=False

Ah, ok that makes sense. Now you just need to remove the double set of quotes, and I think you have a valid json_query expression. Didn't turn out as bad as I expected üòä"}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-05 21:32:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

> 
> Ah, ok that makes sense. Now you just need to remove the double set of quotes, and I think you have a valid json_query expression. Didn't turn out as bad as I expected üòä

Oh hmm - this is no good yet either because of https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/9f6bf94d1a922553f7bc9b3a614b857b666822db#diff-81778cd8cb530cb7fde96dcab4213abae4e868fec833c2a5a47105b8571ca19a

The interface name may contain a dot."}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-03-05 22:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-03-05 22:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> Oh hmm - this is no good yet either because of https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/9f6bf94d1a922553f7bc9b3a614b857b666822db#diff-81778cd8cb530cb7fde96dcab4213abae4e868fec833c2a5a47105b8571ca19a
> 
> The interface name may contain a dot.

I wouldn't expect single-quotes to work, as in that commit.

JMESPathError in json_query filter plugin:\nExpecting: ['quoted_identifier', 'unquoted_identifier', 'lbracket', 'lbrace'], got: literal: Parse error at column 14, token \"br_mgmt\" (LITERAL), for expression:\n\"ansible_facts.'br_mgmt'.ipv4.address\"

But double-quotes seem to work for that;
metal_address: "ansible_facts.\"br_mgmt\".ipv4.address"
hostvars[inventory_hostname] | json_query(metal_address)": "172.29.236.2"

I remember having to use double-quotes for dashes in the names. eg. "br-mgmt"'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-08 07:45:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Patch Set 15 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-03-09 14:58:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-03-14 20:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-01 12:36:20.000000000', 'message': 'Gather minimal facts for dynamic_address_fact

Currently this code assumes that there are facts available for all
network interfaces on the host. This may be hundreds of interfaces
for compute or network nodes.

If the OSA fact gathering is switched to be minimal to increase
deployment performance then is is necessary to gather information
about the interface to take the dynamiclly selected IP address from.

This patch adds a network facts gathering task which is filtered to
return only facts about the network interfaces specified in
container_networks, or in a new override dynamic_address_gather_filter.

The network facts are also now accessed via ansible_facts[] instead
of the hostvar ansible_<interface>.

Change-Id: Ib6c117b27b84d911baad8f85ec3128965dd4c6c2

commit_message:
Gather minimal facts for dynamic_address_fact

Currently this code assumes that there are facts available for all
network interfaces on the host. This may be hundreds of interfaces
for compute or network nodes.

If the OSA fact gathering is switched to be minimal to increase
deployment performance then is is necessary to gather information
about the interface to take the dynamiclly selected IP address from.

This patch adds a network facts gathering task which is filtered to
return only facts about the network interfaces specified in
container_networks, or in a new override dynamic_address_gather_filter.

The network facts are also now accessed via ansible_facts[] instead
of the hostvar ansible_<interface>.

Change-Id: Ib6c117b27b84d911baad8f85ec3128965dd4c6c2

commit_message:
Add config use-internal-endpoints option.

This patch adds a configuration option that instructs
openstack-dashboard to configure Horizon using the internal host
exposed by the keystone charm, this behavior is already present in
other charms like nova-cloud-controller.

Change-Id: Ic372a2c65c52a77229c5c2867919aa318e9ac0a1
Closes-Bug: #1812361
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-keystone/+/696997

commit_message:
Quota: Fix multiple race conditions

This patch fixes 2 race condition areas and adds a comment on why we are
not fixing another 2.

Both race conditions that we fix could have been fixed with a
"with_for_update", but one of them is more effciently handled doing a
single query update instead of retrieving the data and deleting one by
one each row.

Change-Id: I2900c8b4c06ce1a4c2bd6bb5da5274883f6a01fb

subject: Use consistent names for service_credentials options

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-16 02:55:05.000000000', 'message': 'Use consistent names for service_credentials options

This change renames ceilometer::agent::auth and its parameters to be
consistent with the section name and the parameter names in ceilometer
service. This allows operators more easily guess how the class and its
parameters correspond to the options in ceilometer.

Change-Id: I7ec7e5e36cad537117e8abb8fe0e67b8b8be48e9

commit_message:
Use consistent names for service_credentials options

This change renames ceilometer::agent::auth and its parameters to be
consistent with the section name and the parameter names in ceilometer
service. This allows operators more easily guess how the class and its
parameters correspond to the options in ceilometer.

Change-Id: I7ec7e5e36cad537117e8abb8fe0e67b8b8be48e9

commit_message:
Allow hacking to be used as a pre-commit hook

This allows hacking to be used the same way flake8 is used as
a pre-commit hook. This allows repository owners to control bumping
using `pre-commit auto-update` when they feel appropriate.

Change-Id: Id00b79ff3006c390f925dcc5031ac503374cf9bd
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/783828

[{'created': '2021-03-18 17:10:36.000000000', 'message': "[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I701473f4d99e0be06dea494eee4f08212bb7d853

[{'account_id': 28751, 'date': '2018-07-24 17:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-24 17:15:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-10-16 21:36:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-09-05 20:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
added config variable for domain in instance-ha resources

an ansible config variable was added to configure domain in an easy way instead of
having to configure domain in several places in roles/instanceha/task/apply.yaml

Change-Id: Iab9311158d012a1aeb9a44a8de2d1dd41870372f

commit_message:
Filter "Starting" and "Stopping" keywords when deleting resources
Sometimes the some resource can be in Starting status and resourceid will return "Starting", which will fail to uninstall

Change-Id: I8cb5616aecdca52ab253144b8b27a25539935d79

messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-03-18 18:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-03-24 12:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-30 15:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29865, 'date': '2021-04-06 12:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 18:44:44.000000000', 'message': "[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I8c89b6d193f221faad4db9e1d0b0152f262b823b
"}, {'created': '2021-03-24 12:13:24.000000000', 'message': "[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I8c89b6d193f221faad4db9e1d0b0152f262b823b
"}]
commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I8c89b6d193f221faad4db9e1d0b0152f262b823b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-02 14:01:22.000000000', 'message': 'Cinder stable/ussuri release for os-brick

The reason for this quick release after the previous ussuri
release (3.0.5 on 11 March, 2021) is the inclusion of a critical
os-brick patch[1] that fixes a potential data loss situation.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-brick/+/784095

Change-Id: I4c30de49d40c79ae7ed54b158ed4250e6488073e
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder stable/ussuri release for os-brick

The reason for this quick release after the previous ussuri
release (3.0.5 on 11 March, 2021) is the inclusion of a critical
os-brick patch[1] that fixes a potential data loss situation.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-brick/+/784095

Change-Id: I4c30de49d40c79ae7ed54b158ed4250e6488073e

commit_message:
Remove nested quota leftovers

In change-id Ide2d53caf1bc5e3ba49f34b2f48de31abaf655d0 we removed the
nested quotas, but there are still some leftover code of it in cinder.

This code is useless, and in some cases not cheap, for example the call
to quota_allocated_get_all_by_project we do in every reservation.

This patch removes most of the remaining nested quota code and leaves
the DB structure changes for the next cycle, since removing them now
would break rolling upgrades.

Change-Id: Ibdbef651208c856ed75dd9af4dd711895e212910

commit_message:
Set cirros image to local one

Cirros image are already cached on the image on /opt/cache/files
directory.
Also set the retry_image to true, in the case the cirros image isn't
there, try to download from other sources

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/778155
Change-Id: I82bc48159c0e4341737dc6888dd8b0911d546cd0

commit_message:
Ability to add extra package manager configuration

This change implements openstack_hosts_package_manager_extra_conf variable which allows to add extra content into package manager's configuration(works with apt,yum and dnf).

Change-Id: Icbd3350c11bd0698bffc2083215ad51af759d5ef
(cherry picked from commit 853114ea286163c882faedc6a5ac41369c23cdff)

[{'created': '2021-03-24 15:36:48.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9b970a1de6215757a94fee5aafae1f8dbac78c93
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9b970a1de6215757a94fee5aafae1f8dbac78c93

commit_message:
Remove duplicated roles

ansible-role-atos-hsm [1] and ansible-role-thales-hsm [2] have been moved into
the Barbican umbrella [3], they are duplicated.

These changes remove them from the OSA scope.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L54
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L60
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/e7a8fe847847c82c21e9a9eb8d80413c6ecc8b4a

Change-Id: Iaff0660123fcca97f3a2b2a44fd258ba6b0aec9b

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I3ff3ce4f150854ece690f1bcbd7183f511fccf2e

commit_message:
Enable nested virt for scenario 10 octavia kvm job

For sc10 kvm jobs, we need to enable nested virt on the host.
It adds the execution point for the same.

It cannot be enabled by default for sc10 kvm jobs as
not all upstream cloud support nested virtualization.

Earlier sc10 kvm jobs were not added to the pipeline.
We are working on enabling it here:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/q/topic:%22fix_octavia_kvm%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

and here is the test project change:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/32573

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ida4349a1f0fdee5dce0ec2bbc96d0567c6d075d0

subject: Moving OSA roles to trailing projects
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-04-01 11:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-04-01 11:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-01 14:05:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think I'm not quite understand what "other" means which is current setup and possible side effects of this change. But yes, we branch roles right before branching main repo'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-01 14:06:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> I think I'm not quite understand what "other" means which is current setup and possible side effects of this change. But yes, we branch roles right before branching main repo

Another thing, is that this list of roles is not quite accurate. Would be great to find a template from which this file is created to avoid placing repos that are deprecated for years'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-04-06 07:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> I think I'm not quite understand what "other" means which is current setup and possible side effects of this change. 

"Other" mean: Deliverables without a more specific categorization are listed as other [1].

It's more or less an "else" type if others types doesn't fit well. It will not have more side effects than give you 3 more months to deliver them.

> But yes, we branch roles right before branching main repo

However the "other" type also said that: The deadline for producing such a deliverable in a development cycle is the ‚ÄòFinal RCs and intermediary releases‚Äô week, usually located at R-1.

Your main repo is trailing so the deadline for them is 3 months after the coordinated series, so,
definitelly, R-1 not fit well to your roles.

Also notice that each cycle since awhile these roles are forgot and didn't respect the R-1 deadline. By moving them to trailling project we avoid confusing and we move them to a type that fit better to your needs.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/reference/deliverable_types.html#other
[2] https://releases.openstack.org/reference/deliverable_types.html#trailing'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-04-06 08:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > I think I'm not quite understand what "other" means which is current setup and possible side effects of this change. But yes, we branch roles right before branching main repo
> 
> Another thing, is that this list of roles is not quite accurate. Would be great to find a template from which this file is created to avoid placing repos that are deprecated for years

I think that this can be solved by adding `release-management: none` to the governance reference [1]. Or maybe by just removing those who are depreacted from this list, it's more a question for the TC.

Our tools use this list to determine which deliverables are (or not) on the rails during a series, the release repo reflect the governance datas.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L1985-L2046'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-06 08:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-06 08:51:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Our tools use this list to determine which deliverables are (or not) on the rails during a series, the release repo reflect the governance datas.
> 
> [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L1985-L2046

Well, we don't have ansible-role-atos-hsm, os_almanach, os_watcher, etc in that list, but it's present in generated deliverables."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-04-06 11:44:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Our tools use this list to determine which deliverables are (or not) on the rails during a series, the release repo reflect the governance datas.
> > 
> > [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L1985-L2046
> 
> Well, we don't have ansible-role-atos-hsm, os_almanach, os_watcher, etc in that list, but it's present in generated deliverables.

ansible-role-atos-hsm is now owned by the Barbican team https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L54 . I'll remove that one with a follow-up patch to avoid duplicating it between teams.

Concerning os_almanach and os_watcher I can't find them in the governance list, maybe we can just remove them with a follow up patch too, any opinion?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-04-06 11:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I proposed a patch to remove the ansible roles (atos and thales) https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/784933/'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-06 12:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> I proposed a patch to remove the ansible roles (atos and thales) https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/784933/

I was removing them previous release manually before branching. And will clean it up this time as well. It was more about preventing to appear in the future'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-04-06 12:38:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

looks OK to change type to trailing + approved by PTL'}]

commit_message:
Moving OSA roles to trailing projects

OpenstackAnsible is a trailing project so we think that these roles
should be aligned with the parent project of OSA team.

During previous series these roles and the parent project have
been branched more or less at the same time [1][2].

These changes propose to embrace the trailing nature of these
roles to avoid confusing at the end of each series.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/d35b5cce08ff8ffe44a20e4928013e6466dda761
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/e838bcf0036c5814aa0d9962d8fd1d49967af619

Change-Id: I43381fa4becc006b64482ba0e16cd1b19e556e62

commit_message:
Add missing openstacklib to dependencies

The vswitch::params class includes the openstacklib::defaults class,
thus puppet-openstacklib should be included in dependencies.

Closes-Bug: #1922026
Change-Id: I3000400e380537f0979c19009dc6c354639c2394
(cherry picked from commit 675cdecba21fe16394b7eccf5188f3958afa3fe9)

commit_message:
Further deprecation of ext-port config option

Deprecate ext-port in favour of data-port and bridge-mappings. From now
on ext-port value will be ignored if data-port is specified in the
config. Log an error in the unit's log and display it in the unit's
status so that the user is aware of misconfiguration.

Update and add new unit tests to account for the introduced changes.

Add a new functional test case that verifies correct handling of
data-port and ext-port config options.

Signed-off-by: Przemys≈Çaw Lal <przemyslaw.lal@canonical.com>
Change-Id: I4c6febbb56f9a61ff2519b60d2a746c9580a8f2d

commit_message:
Add missing openstacklib to dependencies

The vswitch::params class includes the openstacklib::defaults class,
thus puppet-openstacklib should be included in dependencies.

Closes-Bug: #1922026
Change-Id: I3000400e380537f0979c19009dc6c354639c2394
(cherry picked from commit 675cdecba21fe16394b7eccf5188f3958afa3fe9)

(cherry picked from commit 41706a3c853ac3a3c03c5812040e4bee4b49eb9c)

policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

Change-Id: I71d9f02360e10fe45d1e956e3a59326e8ba1263a

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: Iec5437a69da1c49c3f59963dd884556b1b5ea44c

commit_message:
Remove all rocky related config/conditionals/tests as tripleo rocky is EOL

Rocky is now EOL since [1][2] so this removes all the rocky related tests
or conditionals.
Related reviews in topic branch tripleo-ci-reduce-rocky [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/774244
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-March/020912.html
[3] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce-rocky

Change-Id: Ibb602d1a2e3bd62463ad8861e66c23248f037923

[{'created': '2021-03-22 18:08:50.000000000', 'message': "[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to replace policy.json to
policy.yaml and remove deprecated policy.json.

config_template has been choosen instead of the copy, since it can
properly handle content that has been lookuped.

We make a separate task not to restart service when it's not needed.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I0606751e4e7707091cd34429deeee01630eb576a

subject: WIP: relinker: tolerate EEXIST due to existing tombstones
messages:
[{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-03-26 15:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-03-26 20:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I currently prefer this solution https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/783467'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-04-06 11:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

alternative merged https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/783467'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-26 15:51:49.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: relinker: tolerate EEXIST due to existing tombstones

If a previous partition power increase failed to cleanup all files in
their old partition locations, then during the next partition power
increase the relinker may find the same file to relink in more than
one source partition. This currently leads to an error log due to the
second relink attempt getting an EEXIST error.

This patch makes the relinker more tolerant of EEXIST errors by
checking if the existing file is a valid diskfile that is at least as
new as the file being linked, and not logging an error if that is the
case.

This relaxed error logging is only applied to tombstone files.

Change-Id: I92d8fcb910b9ce05982f8d12070b92adbe6843b1
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: relinker: tolerate EEXIST due to existing tombstones

If a previous partition power increase failed to cleanup all files in
their old partition locations, then during the next partition power
increase the relinker may find the same file to relink in more than
one source partition. This currently leads to an error log due to the
second relink attempt getting an EEXIST error.

This patch makes the relinker more tolerant of EEXIST errors by
checking if the existing file is a valid diskfile that is at least as
new as the file being linked, and not logging an error if that is the
case.

This relaxed error logging is only applied to tombstone files.

Change-Id: I92d8fcb910b9ce05982f8d12070b92adbe6843b1

commit_message:
Prevent quota and reservations to go into negative

Our current quota usage code doesn't prevent our usage or reservations
to go into negative, though it warns at reservation time.

This patch makes sure that we don't go into negative, setting it to 0 in
case it would be negative.

Change-Id: I487157d7092fa4cee1cd72cf01ce7031c94f553f

commit_message:
Add missing openstacklib to dependencies

The vswitch::params class includes the openstacklib::defaults class,
thus puppet-openstacklib should be included in dependencies.

Closes-Bug: #1922026
Change-Id: I3000400e380537f0979c19009dc6c354639c2394
(cherry picked from commit 675cdecba21fe16394b7eccf5188f3958afa3fe9)

subject: Move static-inventory option into parser group

commit_message:
Move static-inventory option into parser group

Static-inventory should not be in extra_vars_group, this
patch move this option into parser.
It's faling when we want to provide both:
--static-inventory and --extra-vars option since the
extra_vars_group is mutually exclusive.

Change-Id: I973ea8c210db477b735a99755332346a646bea19
(cherry picked from commit 986f9261119f64fcbfe1c3957ee1c721eed370df)

commit_message:
[Testing Infra] Apply here the improvements done to tripleo-validations

This patch brings out the improvements done from tripleo-validations to
validations-common regarding the molecule testing infrastructure with
the UBI8 images.

This patch integrates molecule fix after release of cryptography3.4.
See https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/774747

Related-Bug: #1915101
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2e5ebebdd48e4013aa87868a22807e91feb3ffab
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Declare is_failed_validation variable before if statement

Declare is_failed_validation variable before the if statement otherwise
if results is None, we hit a 'reference before assignment'

Change-Id: I293389c366fd49fbdde2ea55d3a3ebed1c598195

This close to release, all features tend to need a c-r-f.  The failure on zosci was due to resolution of nova.clouds.archive.ubuntu.com which is a know (recurrent) issue that we are trying to track down.'}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2021-04-01 11:20:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The c-r-f failed during the bundle deployment. rabbitmq-server/0 ended up in error state.

`dns.resolver.NoNameservers: All nameservers failed to answer the query 19.110.17.172.in-addr.arpa. IN PTR: Server 127.0.0.53 UDP port 53 answered SERVFAIL`

Perhaps it's a load issue. I'll trigger c-r-f again."}, {'account_id': 32288, 'date': '2021-04-01 11:20:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add action that returns list of registered compute nodes.

List contains only nodes registered to the same nova-cloud-controller
as the nova-compute service running on targeted unit.

Closes-Bug: #1911013
Change-Id: I28d1a9bd18b3a87fc31ff4bca5bfe58449cdae57

commit_message:
Allow to configure policy_dirs

This patch makes it possible to override the current service default,
which is /etc/<service>/policy.d .

Change-Id: I14172b26646254221d5e0816c4c7ebc9da4952fb

deployment of highly available kubernetes
clusters.

commit_message:
[WIP]Support scaling Kubernetes worker nodes with Mgmt driver

A sample script to install and configure
the cluster to add or remove a Worker-node
with MgmtDriver is provided.

This function is updated as sample code:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/777971
Thus, this patch will be abandon

Change-Id: I96029df79dcac795d0b3be82c33b058471767f52

commit_message:
[WIP]Support deploying Kubernetes cluster with Mgmt driver

The newly created script of MgmtDriver,
in the instantiate_end stage, it can
install kubernetes cluster on the VM.

This function is updated as sample code:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/777971
Thus, this patch will be abandon

Change-Id: I90f81b88ce945987e2c93ec5a11d55f8f9e0a6ce

>

Agreed, I'll give it a try and see if there are any complications. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-04 13:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 3:
> > 
> > Thanks for the patch Przemyslaw. Just an initial observation, I wonder if we could move some of this code to charm-helpers for re-use.
> 
> Agreed, I'll give it a try and see if there are any complications. Thanks.

Two functions that are common for neutron-gateway and this patch have been proposed to be merged to charm-helpers here:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/583
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/584

All DPDK specific bits that are based on 'ovs-vsctl set' commands can be left here, though I'll try to  refactor this code a little to use the "brdata" argument that is already supported in charm-helpers.'}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-04 15:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Rework in progress.'}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-05 14:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-05 14:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Moved some stuff over to charm-helpers and synced with the latest version.
Got rid of the old dpdk_do_something() functions that were calling ovs-vsctl directly. Now DPDK ports and bonds are configured through ifdata and portdata args passed to charmhelpers OVS functions.

Ready for review.'}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-05 14:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-05 15:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-05 15:03:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I have a lot more to review here (both code and functionality). But my initial problem is that we have three distinct changes:
* adding external ids
* refactoring the dpdk functions
* changing assess status

This feels like way too much for a single commit. Ideally this would be three (potentially stacked) commits. As is, if we have to do a partial revert this will be painful.'}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-24 11:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-24 11:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-24 11:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 33148, 'date': '2021-03-24 12:44:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

> Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> I have a lot more to review here (both code and functionality). But my initial problem is that we have three distinct changes:
> * adding external ids
> * refactoring the dpdk functions
> * changing assess status
> 
> This feels like way too much for a single commit. Ideally this would be three (potentially stacked) commits. As is, if we have to do a partial revert this will be painful.

Thanks David, per you recommendation I split this change into a series of 3 commits:
1. Use OVS charmhelpers to set up DPDK ports and bridges - refactoring of how DPDK bridges and ports are configured https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch/+/782680
2. Set external-ids for managed OVS bridges and ports - this change, enables marking of OVS bridges and ports by setting 'external-ids' property
3. Further deprecation of ext-port config option - changes handling of ext-port and data-port config options https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch/+/782706"}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2021-03-24 14:47:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

> 2. Set external-ids for managed OVS bridges and ports - this change, enables marking of OVS bridges and ports by setting 'external-ids' property
> 3. Further deprecation of ext-port config option - changes handling of ext-port and data-port config options https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch/+/782706

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-03 13:19:00.000000000', 'message': "Set external-ids for managed OVS bridges and ports

Enable marking of OVS bridges and ports as managed by charm-neutron-openvswitch.
This enables more advanced use casees like implmentation of idempotent
config changes or cleanup of stale OVS configuration.

Deprecate ext-port in favour of data-port and bridge-mappings. From now
on ext-port value will be ignored if data-port is specified in the
config. Log an error in the unit's log and display it in the unit's
status so that the user is aware of misconfiguration.

Update and add new unit tests.

Note: This patch is mostly a reimplementation of corresponding change for
charm-neutron-gateway: https://review.opendev.org/717074

Closes-Bug: #1917025
Partial-Bug: #1915967

commit_message:
Set external-ids for managed OVS bridges and ports

Enable marking of OVS bridges and ports as managed by
charm-neutron-openvswitch. This enables more advanced use cases like
implmentation of idempotent config changes or cleanup of stale OVS
configuration.

Include functional test case that verifies whether external-ids are
properly set up on ports and bridges.

Sync charmhelpers.

Closes-Bug: #1917025
Partial-Bug: #1915967

Signed-off-by: Przemys≈Çaw Lal <przemyslaw.lal@canonical.com>
Change-Id: I343f2c8258b7b8b91417dc6efc5bfe95351392a9

There are a number of moving parts to this. I would like to get Frode and or James to look at this as well. I have not yet had time to validate it. We need an actually DPDK validation test.

It looks sane to me. But the moves to charm-helpers are an unknown. We do not appear to use add_bridge_bond anywhere else in our charms which means it is untested.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2021-03-25 10:51:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Thank you for your work on this, you're adding value by taking something away, which is always powerful.

I would like to challenge you to take this a step further as some of the helpers you add here is already implemented in contexts in c-h, see comments in-line.

commit_message:
Use OVS charmhelpers to set up DPDK ports and bridges

Replace deprecated code that was used for setting up DPDK ports and
bonds with calls to charmhelpers functions.
Pass DPDK configuration using ifdata and portdata dicts instead of
making direct ovs-vsctl calls.
Move installation of sriov-netplan-shim to the bash wrapper. This
resolves problems with non-working imports of sriov-netplan-shim in
charmhelpers.

Update unit tests to reflect that change.

Signed-off-by: Przemys≈Çaw Lal <przemyslaw.lal@canonical.com>
Change-Id: Ica6f3ea66136bca6c77a5fb55ad7ef5d95aa1f6a

commit_message:
Update defaults for rhel modules in container base

All rhel releases that use tcib have moved to
rhel 8.4 This patch updates the default module
versions to match the versions required in 8.4.

Change-Id: I3b2075b68695025a543b7ac5612cc73c5858de5b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-26 20:04:29.000000000', 'message': 'WIP relinker: retry links from older part powers

If a previous partition power increase failed to cleanup all files in
their old partition locations, then during the next partition power
increase the relinker may find the same file to relink in more than
one source partition. This currently leads to an error log due to the
second relink attempt getting an EEXIST error.

With this patch, when an EEXIST is raised, the relinker will attempt
to create/verify a link from older partition power location to the
next part power location, and if such a link is found then suppress
the error log.

The error is only supressed for tombstones, and the relinker only
looks back over the previous two partition powers.

Change-Id: If9beb9efabdad64e81d92708f862146d5fafb16c
'}, {'created': '2021-03-29 16:05:56.000000000', 'message': 'relinker: retry links from older part powers

If a previous partition power increase failed to cleanup all files in
their old partition locations, then during the next partition power
increase the relinker may find the same file to relink in more than
one source partition. This currently leads to an error log due to the
second relink attempt getting an EEXIST error.

With this patch, when an EEXIST is raised, the relinker will attempt
to create/verify a link from older partition power locations to the
next part power location, and if such a link is found then suppress
the error log.

During the relink step, if an alternative link is verified and if a
file is found that is neither linked to the next partition power
location nor in the current part power location, then the file is
removed during the relink step. That prevents the same EEXIST occuring
again during the cleanup step when it may no longer be possible to
verify that an alternative link exists.

For example, consider identical filenames in the N+1th, Nth and N-1th
partition power locations, with the N+1th being linked to the Nth:

  - During relink, the Nth location is visited and its link is
    verified. Then the N-1th location is visited and an EEXIST error
    is encountered, but the new check verifies that a link exists to
    the Nth location, which is OK.

  - During cleanup the locations are visited in the same order, but
    files are removed so that the Nth location file no longer exists
    when the N-1th location is visited. If the N-1th location still
    has a conflicting file then existence of an alternative link to
    the Nth location can no longer be verified, so an error would be
    raised. Therefore, the N-1th location file must be removed during
    relink.

The error is only suppressed for tombstones, and the relinker only
looks back over the previous two partition powers.

Closes-Bug: 1921718
Change-Id: If9beb9efabdad64e81d92708f862146d5fafb16c
'}, {'created': '2021-04-01 17:44:20.000000000', 'message': 'relinker: retry links from older part powers

If a previous partition power increase failed to cleanup all files in
their old partition locations, then during the next partition power
increase the relinker may find the same file to relink in more than
one source partition. This currently leads to an error log due to the
second relink attempt getting an EEXIST error.

With this patch, when an EEXIST is raised, the relinker will attempt
to create/verify a link from older partition power locations to the
next part power location, and if such a link is found then suppress
the error log.

During the relink step, if an alternative link is verified and if a
file is found that is neither linked to the next partition power
location nor in the current part power location, then the file is
removed during the relink step. That prevents the same EEXIST occuring
again during the cleanup step when it may no longer be possible to
verify that an alternative link exists.

For example, consider identical filenames in the N+1th, Nth and N-1th
partition power locations, with the N+1th being linked to the Nth:

  - During relink, the Nth location is visited and its link is
    verified. Then the N-1th location is visited and an EEXIST error
    is encountered, but the new check verifies that a link exists to
    the Nth location, which is OK.

  - During cleanup the locations are visited in the same order, but
    files are removed so that the Nth location file no longer exists
    when the N-1th location is visited. If the N-1th location still
    has a conflicting file then existence of an alternative link to
    the Nth location can no longer be verified, so an error would be
    raised. Therefore, the N-1th location file must be removed during
    relink.

The error is only suppressed for tombstones. The number of partition
power location that the relinker will look back over may be configured
using the link_check_limit option in a conf file or --link-check-limit
on the command line, and defaults to 2.

Closes-Bug: 1921718
Change-Id: If9beb9efabdad64e81d92708f862146d5fafb16c

commit_message:
relinker: retry links from older part powers

If a previous partition power increase failed to cleanup all files in
their old partition locations, then during the next partition power
increase the relinker may find the same file to relink in more than
one source partition. This currently leads to an error log due to the
second relink attempt getting an EEXIST error.

With this patch, when an EEXIST is raised, the relinker will attempt
to create/verify a link from older partition power locations to the
next part power location, and if such a link is found then suppress
the error log.

During the relink step, if an alternative link is verified and if a
file is found that is neither linked to the next partition power
location nor in the current part power location, then the file is
removed during the relink step. That prevents the same EEXIST occuring
again during the cleanup step when it may no longer be possible to
verify that an alternative link exists.

For example, consider identical filenames in the N+1th, Nth and N-1th
partition power locations, with the N+1th being linked to the Nth:

  - During relink, the Nth location is visited and its link is
    verified. Then the N-1th location is visited and an EEXIST error
    is encountered, but the new check verifies that a link exists to
    the Nth location, which is OK.

  - During cleanup the locations are visited in the same order, but
    files are removed so that the Nth location file no longer exists
    when the N-1th location is visited. If the N-1th location still
    has a conflicting file then existence of an alternative link to
    the Nth location can no longer be verified, so an error would be
    raised. Therefore, the N-1th location file must be removed during
    relink.

The error is only suppressed for tombstones. The number of partition
power location that the relinker will look back over may be configured
using the link_check_limit option in a conf file or --link-check-limit
on the command line, and defaults to 2.

Closes-Bug: 1921718
Change-Id: If9beb9efabdad64e81d92708f862146d5fafb16c

commit_message:
Do not reset tempest version in CI

In CI jobs we fetch the specific version of tempest and use the files
cloned already, so we don't need to reset its version explicitly.

Change-Id: I0bae1f8e304e7f879fa3975f69067ff3864fd4ba
(cherry picked from commit 3ac64d4f459481cfffbc408f4ff516eeebeef70e)
(cherry picked from commit 557e6220f6da44f8b621a944d457d6ff2ad7d66e)

commit_message:
Ubuntu: Install neutron-tempest-plugin from source

It seems the current latest version of neutron-tempest-plugin available
in pip is not compatible with the latest tempest. Let's install it
from source so that we can always install the version compatible with
tempest.

Note:
Added version pin for stable backports.

Change-Id: I57f84757a229feb4e7d94ec912d723bf02392c88
(cherry picked from commit 7b8b11a8cfe98e6b2f08c3edc6b9b9222edeb937)
(cherry picked from commit 2e4793c0707274e90d7d8ebf7c2b4a01d432f2b7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-16 10:55:44.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix inconsistent IGMP configuration

Prior to this patch the IGMP configuration for ML2/OVN was incosistent
with the configuration option description and also the ML2/OVS driver
because it was flooding traffic to unregistered VMs [0].

The "igmp_snooping_enable" configuration option says:

"Setting this option to True will also enable Open vSwitch
mcast-snooping-disable-flood-unregistered flag. This option will disable
flooding of unregistered multicast packets to all ports."

But, in ML2/OVN that behavior was inconsistent prior to this patch
because it allowed traffic to flood to unregistered VMs. This patch
fixes it.

[0]
https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/branch/master/neutron/conf/agent/ovs_conf.py#L36-L47

Change-Id: I5cbe09e26120905b29351d61bbadb30b5dd14938
Closes-Bug: #1904399
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-11-25 16:48:14.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix inconsistent IGMP configuration

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix inconsistent IGMP configuration

Prior to this patch the IGMP configuration for ML2/OVN was inconsistent
with the configuration option description and also the ML2/OVS driver
because it was flooding traffic to unregistered VMs [0].

The "igmp_snooping_enable" configuration option says:

"Setting this option to True will also enable Open vSwitch
mcast-snooping-disable-flood-unregistered flag. This option will disable
flooding of unregistered multicast packets to all ports."

But, in ML2/OVN that behavior was inconsistent prior to this patch
because it allowed traffic to flood to unregistered VMs. This patch
fixes it.

[0]
https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/branch/master/neutron/conf/agent/ovs_conf.py#L36-L47

Change-Id: I5cbe09e26120905b29351d61bbadb30b5dd14938
Closes-Bug: #1904399
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie7c0369b230d66ceb29a950f605e41a09b3b92e1

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0e9d0c26717e3dec69364f38aaf54ba1d150868c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-29 14:23:36.000000000', 'message': "Support reading Kayobe environment name from file

If using separate branches for each environment, it can be useful to
read the environment name from a file committed to each branch. Or, if
sharing the same branch for all environments, it can be useful to set
the default environment to one with lower impact, e.g. dev or staging.

If no --environment option is specified and a .environment file exists
at the root of the directory, use its content as KAYOBE_ENVIRONMENT.

Also add a missing `return 1` statement which meant a missing argument
to --environment didn't cause the script to exit with an error.

Change-Id: I22b2b466e47a3b4d96931d754a4de7544f0ada5d
"}, {'created': '2021-03-31 12:57:03.000000000', 'message': 'Support reading Kayobe environment name from file

If using separate branches for each environment, it can be useful to
read the environment name from a file committed to each branch. Or, if
sharing the same branch for all environments, it can be useful to set
the default environment to one with lower impact, e.g. dev or staging.

If no --environment option is specified and a .environment file exists
at the root of the directory, use its content as KAYOBE_ENVIRONMENT.

Change-Id: I22b2b466e47a3b4d96931d754a4de7544f0ada5d
'}]
commit_message:
Support reading Kayobe environment name from file

If using separate branches for each environment, it can be useful to
read the environment name from a file committed to each branch. Or, if
sharing the same branch for all environments, it can be useful to set
the default environment to one with lower impact, e.g. dev or staging.

If no --environment option is specified and a .environment file exists
at the root of the directory, use its content as KAYOBE_ENVIRONMENT.

Change-Id: I22b2b466e47a3b4d96931d754a4de7544f0ada5d

commit_message:
Stop accessing unbound variables

The kayobe-env script would try accessing $1 which is an unbound
variable if no argument is passed. This fails when `set -u` is set.

Also refactor usage output into a function. As a side effect, a missing
argument to --environment now causes the script to properly exit with an
error.

Change-Id: I9a44578196086ec24de80b992fed385826778feb
